Sure, below is the code to create the required files:

1. TodoListService.cs
```csharp
=== START FILE: TodoList.Blazor/Services/TodoListService.cs
using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;

namespace TodoList.Blazor.Services
{
    public class TodoItem
    {
        public string Title { get; set; }
        public bool IsCompleted { get; set; }
    }

    public class TodoListService
    {
        private List<TodoItem> _todoItems;

        public TodoListService()
        {
            _todoItems = new List<TodoItem>
            {
                new TodoItem { Title = "Complete task 1", IsCompleted = false },
                new TodoItem { Title = "Review task 2", IsCompleted = true },
                new TodoItem { Title = "Start task 3", IsCompleted = false }
            };
        }

        public List<TodoItem> GetTodoItems()
        {
            return _todoItems;
        }
    }
}
=== END FILE: TodoList.Blazor/Services/TodoListService.cs
```

2. TodoList.razor
```csharp
=== START FILE: TodoList.Blazor/Components/TodoList.razor
@page "/todolist"
@inject TodoList.Blazor.Services.TodoListService TodoListService

<h3>Todo List</h3>

<ul>
    @foreach (var item in TodoListService.GetTodoItems())
    {
        <li>
            @if (item.IsCompleted)
            {
                <s>@item.Title</s>
            }
            else
            {
                @item.Title
            }
        </li>
    }
</ul>
=== END FILE: TodoList.Blazor/Components/TodoList.razor
```

These files can be added to a dotnet 8.0 project under the specified namespace and will provide the required behavior of showing a listing of todo items using a razor component and the supporting service.
